DialogueOption.Text: I heard you delayed your launch date several times! Why’s that?

Dialogue.Page: Ah, I’m guessing you heard about this from Mica?
I hope you didn’t take too long to take off yourself - otherwise, they’ll be telling the future space cadets about how you delayed your launch as well!
That aside.. The reason I delayed my launch date was because the sand on Ember Twin was flowing to Ash Twin at the time.
Since I was hoping to explore Ash Twin on my first trip, the sand burying it would’ve made exploring anything rather hard!
That’s why I opted to delay my launch - though more times than I'd have liked - until the sand began to flow back to Ember Twin.

DialogueOption.Text: Wait, the sand flows back to Ash Twin?

Dialogue.Page: Indeed I have. I once spotted some tall Nomai structures on Ash Twin's surface while stargazing back on Timber Hearth.

Feldspar made no mention of these structures from their expeditions around the star system - meaning there was a good chance these structures had been buried completely by the Twins' shifting sands and had eluded our notice up until then.
When young Riebeck heard about this discovery, they begged me to fly to Ash Twin to study them in their stead - so I had to oblige!
From what I could tell, the structures appeared to be some sort of Nomai towers made for stargazing; each one has windows in their roofs to peer out and see the planets and stars.
I must say, it was quite heartwarming to learn the Nomai shared my love for the stars!
I looked around for quite some time - but at some point, I realized the sand column had sucked my ship with it back to Ember Twin!
I had to cut my expedition short to make a distress call back to the village, and call Slate to pick me up. <Pause> ..I think he was more worried about my ship than me, though.
Since sand is flowing from Ash Twin to Ember Twin right now, why not check out Ash Twin for yourself, once a little more of its sand drains off?
You should be able to glean much more about what these structures were made for than I did - especially with that new translator tool of yours. Just be careful where you leave your ship!

DialogueOption.Text: I already did! Those are Nomai warp towers that connect to the other planets.
Tell me more about the Twins' shifting sands!

Dialogue.Page: Why, yes! Haven’t you noticed before?
Right now, sand is flowing to Ember Twin - but I promise, if you wait, you’ll see the process eventually reverses, causing sand to flow back towards Ash Twin!
Furthermore, this process seems to happen in very precise intervals; the durations between intervals have been consistent every time we've measured it. It's terribly fascinating!

DialogueOption.Text: Huh. Could you tell how long it'd take for the sand to start flowing back to Ash Twin, then?

Dialogue.Page: I'd be glad to!
Right now, sand is flowing to Ember Twin - but did you know the process eventually reverses? If you wait, you’ll see it eventually flows back to Ash Twin!
Furthermore, this process seems to happen in very precise intervals; the durations between intervals have been consistent every time we've measured it. It's terribly fascinating!

DialogueOption.Text: Huh. Could you tell how long it'd take for the sand to start flowing back to Ash Twin, then?

Dialogue.Page: I’m afraid that.. might be difficult, since I wasn't keeping track when the sand started flowing.. That makes it harder to know the exact time, since the interval has already started.
That's why I had to delay my launch date several times, to answer your very first question! I did not anticipate the process taking quite so many Hearthian days to complete.
Come back once more of the sand has drained off from Ash Twin! I might be able to give you a more precise answer then.
If you’re feeling impatient, feel free to take a nap by the campfire to pass the time.
I intentionally set up this camp far from the equator, where the sand column roams - so you need not worry about the sand column wandering this way while you rest.

DialogueOption.Text: Cool, cool. Tell me about what you found on Ash Twin, though!

Dialogue.Page: Goodness! That's right, that's what we were discussing at first, wasn't it? My apologies for rambling!

Feldspar made no mention of these structures from their expeditions around the star system - meaning there was a good chance these structures had been buried completely by the Twins' shifting sands and had eluded our notice up until then.

You should be able to glean much more about what these structures were made for than I did - especially with that new translator tool of yours. Just be careful where you leave your ship!

DialogueOption.Text: I already did! Those are warp towers that the Nomai used to travel to the other planets.

Dialogue.Page: Goodness! That's what those towers are?! How.. how could I have missed that?
This does sound quite plausible.. The model ship and the Little Scouts do utilize some kind of Nomai warp technology that lets us warp them back to a fixed point, don't they?
Oh, a Nomai warp system right under our noses... If I had been more observant, our space program might be revolutionized by now!
But, you said that the Nomai used these "warp towers" to travel around their settlements across the star system easily..
There are Nomai ruins on Timber Hearth as well - so could there be a "warp tower" that connects to Timber Hearth as well? And if so - where would you arrive on Timber Hearth?

DialogueOption.Text: There sure is! One of the warp towers travels to the Nomai Ruins outside the village.

Dialogue.Page: Imagine how much easier space travel would be for the space program, if this warp system connected us back to Timber Hearth!
I would love nothing more than to go investigate for myself while the sand is flowing from Ash Twin.. but I must focus on finishing these star charts!
Would you kindly investigate in my stead? I shall catch up with you as soon as I finish these charts.
Oh, what terrific news!
..What's that? There's GHOST MATTER on the arrival point?!
(sigh) What terrific news... Oh, how frustrating..
I suppose until we find a way around ghost matter - or more likely, that patch of ghost matter evaporates with time - the space program will be stuck flying Slate's ships..
